Articles.Content: I think there should be some life support parts for like air, water, and heating/cooling.

Life Support is one of the many entries on our handy [thread=36863]What Not to Suggest List[/thread]. I'd advise you read it at least once through (it's not that long, really) before posting further suggestions. If you're interested in modded attempts at creating life support systems, there are links on the WNTS list to mods which have this functionality.

Life support is a pretty common suggestion as you might imagine, with KSP being a space flight simulator and all. If my memory serves me well, the occasions where a developer has decided to address the topic of life support generally hinge around wanting to make sure that a) it's reasonably realistic and predictable, and that it doesn't introduce so much menial micromanagement that it shifts focus away from the main point of KSP -- building and flying ships. (If indeed they choose to implement it at all, but who can say at this point, really...) I don't recall any explicit statements as to whether or not it is actually a planned feature, though...

Anyhow, for these reasons, I'm going to have to lock this one, sorry.

(Bit of a poor welcome to the forums, isn't it? Apologies for that; I'm sure the other members will take care of welcoming you warmly in some fashion.)
